issue.title: [C++][Docs] Provide more complete linking/CMake project example
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-16221](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16221). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
While there's a minimal example of using CMake to link against Arrow, a fuller example (or two) showing some of the Arrow libraries, the bundled dependencies (in the static build), etc. would also be useful.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16221?focusedCommentId=17524579) by Will Jones (willjones127):*
I had started earlier to make a template repo that used vcpkg and cmake to link against Arrow, such that one could install dependencies and build with only 3 commands. Got it somewhat working on MacOS, but in theory should be able to get that to work on all platforms. https://github.com/wjones127/arrow_cpp_example

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16221?focusedCommentId=17524623) by David Li (lidavidm):*
Ah, that would be nice. It would also be good to demonstrate building against conda-forge packages too.
